sect1.title: BITNOT
sect1.para: Return the bitwise complement of the argument.

itemizedlist.para: <rhs> - Value to invert. Must be an integer

sect2.title: Returns
sect2.para: Returns the bitwise complement of the arguments. (The bits are inverted)

sect2.title: Example
sect2.programlisting: make “foo -1 ; TODO: Provide a way to specify values in other radixes (radices?) make “bar bitnot :foo ; bar == 0 make “foo 65534 make "bar bitnot :foo ; bar == 1 (assuming unsigned 16 bit)
